line_1: But when kind Fate, or pressing Want oblige
line_2: Th' investing Host to raise the fruitless Siege,

line_1: Go with soft flattery, studious to oblige,
line_2: Some dull, and self-admiring lord besiege,

line_1: Let Speech lay by its Roughness to oblige,
line_2: Your speaking Life will carry on the Siege:

line_1: 'Tis easier far to give, than to oblige.
line_2: Which cramm'd, yet craving, still their gates besiege,
